pullRequest.title: AArch64: Add instructions for enabling CUDA support
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit adds description on how to build AArch64 Linux OpenJ9 with
CUDA enabled.
Signed-off-by: KONNO Kazuhiro konno@jp.ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: If the version of CUDA being used is 8.0 or newer, the -with-gdk option is not necessary.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -719,6 +719,8 @@ bash configure --openjdk-target=${OPENJ9_CC_PREFIX} \
 
 :pencil: **DDR support:** You can build DDR support only on AArch64 Linux.  If you are building in a cross-compilation environment, you need the `--disable-ddr` option.
 
+:pencil: **CUDA support:** You can enable CUDA support if you are building on NVIDIA Jetson Developer Kit series.  Add `--enable-cuda --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda --with-gdk=/usr/local/cuda` when you run `configure`.  The path `/usr/local/cuda` may be different depending on the version of JetPack.

commit.message:
AArch64: Add instructions for enabling CUDA support

This commit adds description on how to build AArch64 Linux OpenJ9 with
CUDA enabled.

Signed-off-by: KONNO Kazuhiro <konno@jp.ibm.com>
